p: There were symptoms of fungal diseases on the black locust trees examined in our study. They were caused by the following pathogens: Pl. robiniae, Ph. Robiniae, and E. polygoni. Each of these species had a specific adverse effect on the decorative values of R. pseudoacacia trees. They caused unsightly discoloration of leaves, premature defoliation or a mycelial cover on the surface of leaves. There were similar observations made in research on the occurrence of black locust pathogens in Germany [ 94].
